stem: A 50-year-old man complains of a long-standing black spot with approximately 5mm diameter on his thigh, which has recently become darker with a bloody discharge. Which of the following is the most appropriate management option?
disc:
Melanoma can occur in sun-exposed as well as covered areas of the skin. Asymmetric, uneven borders, uneven colors, and the recent increase in size strongly suggest the diagnosis.

A full-thickness biopsy is essential in diagnosing melanoma. A sentinel lymph node biopsy is required for staging.

Treatment is surgical removal with a satisfactory margin of normal skin.
